fields.summary: Quota limiting run instances against availabilityzone resource does not work

comments.body: One aspect of the bug was fixed. But there is another issue related to EUCA-4357.
This is excellent news if the quota mentioned in this bug has been fixed for 3.2.  I haven't tested it since it was marked as unresolved, so considered it still open/valid/applicable.
I am still seeing this issue in 3.2.1 I am investigating.

hi Lester,

The following seems to work, can you test it out and let me know the results.

To me this issue seems like a feature request not a bug, for it to work you would have to be able to count resources (in this case instances) using arbitrary filters (such as availability zone) which is not currently supported.

If the desired result is that an account cannot run instances in the specified availability zone when the account has the specified number of instances running in the cloud then that seems feasible (but I don't see much use for that)

Ok, so this becomes a usability and docs issue I guess.  Usability in a sesnse that the problem with the example from [~mmunn1] is that it isn't so straight forward for the user anymore.  

The above satisfies _me_ but we clearly need to improve the documentation here:

http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/3.2/ag/access_policy_quota.html#access_policy_quota

[~lwade] my understanding of [~mmunn1]s suggested policy is that is the restriction is not related to any particular availability zone (so the reference to the zone could be removed without any change of behaviour). As such we should probably not document it, since it may mislead users into thinking the availability zone reference is meaningful.

I have not tested the policy, please let me know if my understanding is incorrect.

Hey [~sjones].  That's right, I just tried it.  I agree re: availability zone, it serves no purpose in the quota and is confusing.

Ok, we need a linked feature request for this.  We have users who really want to be able to shift accounts into particular clusters/AZ's based on their usage patterns, so this is important.
Added https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-5326 to track with product mgmt.
I am closing this as a "Not a bug" as this is actually a feature request see:  https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-5326.
Closing Resolved issues for released versions of the software.
